meanings.definition: Not involving or using words or speech.
meanings.sent1: She communicated her feelings through nonverbal cues.
meanings.sent2: The mime artist's performance was a great example of nonverbal communication.
meanings.sent3: The silent movie relied solely on nonverbal expressions to tell the story.
meanings.sent4: His nonverbal reaction to the news spoke volumes.
meanings.sent5: The lack of words didn't hinder their nonverbal understanding.

meanings.definition: Communicating without the use of words.
meanings.sent1: They relied on nonverbal to convey their message.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, a simple nonverbal can say more than a thousand words.
meanings.sent3: The game of charades is all about guessing the nonverbal correctly.
meanings.sent4: In a noisy room, their nonverbal was the only way to communicate.
meanings.sent5: His nonverbal was so clear that no words were needed.

meanings.definition: Relating to or involving gestures, facial expressions, body language, etc.
meanings.sent1: Her nonverbal communication skills were exceptional.
meanings.sent2: The speaker's nonverbal cues revealed his true emotions.
meanings.sent3: The nonverbal dance performance was both entertaining and expressive.
meanings.sent4: His nonverbal behavior indicated his discomfort in the situation.
meanings.sent5: The nonverbal interaction between the two characters was captivating.
